skill.name: wcag-audit-patterns
skill.description: Conduct WCAG 2.2 accessibility audits with automated testing, manual verification, and remediation guidance. Use when auditing websites for accessibility, fixing WCAG violations, or implementing accessible design patterns.
skill.summary: Conduct WCAG 2.2 accessibility audits with automated testing, manual verification, and remediation g...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing WCAG 2.2 audit guidance. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file access, or system interactions are present. The skill only contains markdown documentation with checklists and code examples for reference. All 86 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown syntax (code block delimiters flagged as shell execution, section headers flagged as crypto algorithms, accessibility testing references flagged as reconnaissance).

content.user_title: Run WCAG 2.2 audits with clear checklists
content.value_statement: Accessibility audits are complex and easy to miss critical issues. This skill provides WCAG 2.2 checklists, test guidance, and remediation patterns for websites and applications.
actual_capabilities: Provides WCAG 2.2 conformance level overview and POUR principles
Supplies detailed audit checklists for all four WCAG principles
Includes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript remediation examples
Shows automated testing snippets with axe-core and Playwright
Lists CLI tools for accessibility scans and validation
limitations: Does not run scans or tests automatically
Does not provide legal advice for compliance matters
Requires manual verification for many criteria

use_cases.title: Audit release readiness
use_cases.description: Use the checklist to validate key pages before a production release.

use_cases.title: Improve component patterns
use_cases.description: Apply remediation patterns to fix labels, contrast, and focus states.

use_cases.title: Prepare a WCAG review
use_cases.description: Map findings to WCAG levels and document gaps for a report.

prompt_templates.title: Basic audit checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a beginner checklist for a small marketing site, focusing on WCAG A and AA items.

prompt_templates.title: Form fixes guide
prompt_templates.prompt: List the top WCAG issues for forms and provide concrete HTML fixes for labels and errors.

prompt_templates.title: Automated testing plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a plan using axe-core and Playwright to catch WCAG 2.2 AA issues.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced audit report
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft an audit outline with evidence collection steps and remediation priorities.

output_examples.input: Audit our checkout flow for WCAG 2.2 AA issues.
output: Check keyboard access for all interactive elements
Verify color contrast on primary buttons and error text
Ensure form inputs have labels and error messages are announced
Add skip link and validate focus visibility
Document fixes and retest with axe-core

output_examples.input: What are the critical WCAG issues to check on a landing page?
output: Missing alt text on images and icons
No keyboard access to buttons and links
Low color contrast on text and backgrounds
Missing form labels on signup fields
No visible focus indicators on interactive elements

output_examples.input: Help me fix the navigation for screen reader users.
output: Add proper landmarks: main, nav, aside, footer
Use semantic HTML for navigation menus
Ensure skip to main content link exists
Add ARIA labels for custom menu buttons
Test reading order with screen reader software

best_practices: Combine automated checks with manual testing
Use semantic HTML before adding ARIA
Record evidence and prioritize by impact
anti_patterns: Remove focus outlines for visual design
Use color as the only status indicator

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is tool agnostic and works in any assistant.

faq.question: What are the limits of the audit content?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run tests or access your site.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI pipelines?
faq.answer: It suggests axe-core and Playwright patterns you can adapt to CI.

faq.question: Is my data accessed or stored?
faq.answer: No. The skill is documentation and does not collect data.

faq.question: What if results conflict with tooling?
faq.answer: Use manual checks to confirm and treat tool output as a starting point.

faq.question: How does this compare to a full audit service?
faq.answer: It guides your process but does not replace expert review or certification.
